oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: The New Digital Bleek and Lloyd Archive
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tamme (XII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tamme's younger brother dies so his mother sleeps outside at the back of the house. When a child dies, another child does not eat. Another child also 'must die'. When a person dies the people bury him or her in the earth. 1) See also Sleeping in ashes and Burial and Burial (another account), 2) This story is found in Book XI & XII-3.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd !kun notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Customs at death
